meanings.definition: A storm or wind blowing from the northeast.
meanings.sent1: During the winter, northeasters can bring heavy snow to our town.
meanings.sent2: The northeasters in this region are known for their strong winds and rain.
meanings.sent3: The northeasters decided to take a break and only blew gentle breezes that day.
meanings.sent4: The northeasters howled like a pack of wolves, shaking the windows.
meanings.sent5: I will never forget the northeasters that knocked down our old oak tree last year.

meanings.definition: A person who lives in the northeastern part of a country.
meanings.sent1: My friend is a northeasters and loves the cold weather up there.
meanings.sent2: Northeasters often have to deal with harsh winters and icy roads.
meanings.sent3: The northeasters threw a snowball at me, showing their playful side.
meanings.sent4: She was a northeasters at heart, always craving the chill of the north.
meanings.sent5: The northeasters greeted me with a warm smile despite the freezing temperatures outside.
